section.title: Overview
section.para: This is a module which provides a FIFO transport layer implementation for Management Interface. It receives the command over a FIFO file and returns the output through the reply_fifo specified.

The module checks every 30 seconds if the FIFO file exists, and if it was deleted, it recreates it. If one wants to force the fifo file recreation, it should send a SIGHUP signal to the MI process PID.

section.title: FIFO command syntax
section.para:
The external commands issued via FIFO interface must follow the following syntax:
request = first_line argument*
first_line = ':'command_name':'reply_fifo'\n'
argument = (arg_name '::' (arg_value)? ) | (arg_value)
arg_name = not-quoted_string
arg_value = not-quoted_string | '"' string '"'
not-quoted_string = string - {',",\n,\r}

section.title: fifo_name (string)
section.para: The name of the FIFO file to be created for listening and reading external commands.

section.title: fifo_mode (integer)
section.para: Permission to be used for creating the listening FIFO file. It follows the UNIX conventions.

section.title: fifo_group (integer) fifo_group (string)
section.para: Group to be used for creating the listening FIFO file.

para.emphasis: Default value is the inherited one.

section.title: fifo_user (integer) fifo_group (string)
section.para: User to be used for creating the listening FIFO file.

para.emphasis: Default value is the inherited one.

section.title: reply_dir (string)
section.para: Directory to be used for creating the reply FIFO files.

section.title: reply_indent (string)
section.para: Strings to be used for line indentation. As the MI data structure is tree oriendeted, the depth level will printed as indentation.

section.title: trace_destination (string)
section.para: Trace destination as defined in the tracing module. Currently the only tracing module is proto_hep. This is where traced mi messages will go.
WARNING: A tracing module must be loaded in order for this parameter to work. (for example proto_hep).

section.title: trace_bwlist (string)
section.para: Filter traced mi commands based on a blacklist or a whitelist. trace_destination must be defined for this parameter to have any purpose. Whitelists can be defined using 'w' or 'W', blacklists using 'b' or 'B'. The type is separate by the actual blacklist by ':'. The mi commands in the list must be separated by ','.

Defining a blacklists means all the commands that are not blacklisted will be traced. Defining a whitelist means all the commands that are not whitelisted will not be traced. WARNING: One can't define both a whitelist and a blacklist. Only one of them is allowed. Defining the parameter a second time will just overwrite the first one.
WARNING: A tracing module must be loaded in order for this parameter to work. (for example proto_hep).

example.title: Set trace_destination parameter
example.programlisting: ... ## blacklist ps and which mi commands ## all the other commands shall be traced modparam("mi_fifo", "trace_bwlist", "b: ps, which") ... ## allow only sip_trace mi command ## all the other commands will not be traced modparam("mi_fifo", "trace_bwlist", "w: sip_trace") ...
